attributes.action: Make fake news reporting by the media a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Fake news stories should never make it to broadcast status or be publicised.
All corporate media outlets whether broadcast news or printed should have to verify, validate and publicise their sources for reports or face criminal charges and heavy financial penalties for disseminating fake news.
attributes.additional_details:
Fake news is a scourge and has been for some considerable time.
It creates distrust of information that is supposed to inform the public.
News media outlets are no longer reliable sources of unbiased news, they are in fact attempting to make news and drive public opinion politically in directions favourable to their owners own views.
The aim of the media is apparently to hold governments and others to account, yet no one is holding the media to account for faking news reports.

attributes.action: Stop sanctions for Jobseekers of 4 weeks or more
attributes.background: People would have no money for food, heating, electricity, clothes and toiletries and risk becoming homeless.  The claimant commitments are too unrealistic and not everyone has access to computers for Universal jobmatch every day or skills needed.
attributes.additional_details:
JSA is only £72 per week and some people must pay Council tax and housing out of this.
Job centre work coaches are getting stressed about issue as they are on the front line and must implement this cruel sanctioning.  Some leave due to a conscience.

attributes.action: Allow town councils to set their own business rates
attributes.background: Small towns across the U.K. Are suffering from empty shops due in part to excessive business rates. These rates should be set locally and councils should be able to suspend temporarily in order to boast local business.
attributes.additional_details: Currently rates are set by the valuation office. They need to be set locally based on requirements and economic growth.

attributes.action: Save our NHS/Social care
attributes.background: The goverment has proved incapable of saving the NHS/social care and making the necessary decisons necessary to do this.  We the public demand taxation is increased and all money raised goes to NHS/Social services only & foreign aid used when people from overseas using our NHS are unable to pay
attributes.additional_details: In order to save NHS/Social care services taxation must be increased with certain conditions applied which must include firstly any extra money raised must ONLY go to the NHS/Social care services, secondly NHS and Social care services must be more integrated, thirdly less financial support for conditions with relate to lifestyle choices such as obesity, alcoholism and drug abuse and finally payment for those using our NHS/Social care from abroad unable to pay taken from foreign aid

attributes.action: I'd like to see the NHS running the National Lottery and keeping all profits.
attributes.background:
We are losing the NHS, it needs emergency care immediately.
Lets start with the obvious and put in a line. We do have one available.
That infusion can come from the National Lottery.

attributes.action: TAX non-reusable sanitary products & give out free reusable pads, cups & nappies
attributes.background:
'Disposable' items such as tampon applicators and wipes pollute our beaches, end up in landfill, and Kill wildlife.
With the revenue generated from the TAX, give out free reusable pads, cups and nappies.
If there is any money leftover this should go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish.
attributes.additional_details:
www.facebook.com/keeptampontax/

https://www.theguardian.com/vital-signs/2015/feb/12/science-plastic-oceans-study-fish-pollution-worse

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/21/flushing-tampons-toilet-blocks-drains-sanitary-products

attributes.action: Student maintenance loans to include parental outgoings as well as incomings
attributes.background: When a student applies for a maintenance loan through Student Finance UK, they have to declare their total annual household income. Whilst this may be effective for the upper and lower class, many of the middle class families lose out substantially.
attributes.additional_details: With a maximum loan of 8,200 for students with an annual household income of less than £25,000, no financial aid is expected of their parents or guardians. However, despite a student turning 18, being a separate legal entity to their parents or guardians, parents are expected to help despite their outgoings. Annual household incomes over £62,177 allow students to be entitled to a £3,821 loan. With accomodation nearly always over this amount, parents are expected to help to the extent of £5,000.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Make labelling GMO foods mandatory.
attributes.background: It is still unsure as to the health effects of Genetically Modified Organism's and there is evidence to support the unsustainablility of GMO's in future agriculture.

attributes.action: Make it law all cars sold  that the driving licence Number of new keeper ON V5
attributes.background: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the communites of the UK
attributes.additional_details: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the community. Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Force Councils to fix the roads throughout England
attributes.background: Within the Northwest alone roads are dangerous cars are avoiding pot holes which in turn could result in a possibly fatal accident. Not only only is this unsafe the overall cost could potentially be higher than if the councils hired someone to fix the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Manchester roads have deep visible cracks which could result in a sink hole, Rochdale roads have potholes inches deep, something needs to be done before an accident occurs.

attributes.action: Make people register for gig tickets before the sale to stop hackers and touts
attributes.background: Its unfair that true fans are missing out on getting tickets to see their favourite artists due to hackers,computer programmes and touts buying tickets in high volumes and re-selling seconds after the tours selling out for extortionate amounts, lets make a registration like glastonbury stand for all

attributes.action: all state visits to be approved by parliament before an invite is given.
attributes.background: to avoid the situation the country is in regarding the trump state visit

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Make it so students can choose a certain method for exams.
attributes.background: Make it so that students can take one of four options for exams at A-level and GCSE: Written, Vocal, Coursework base or practical in as many subjects as possible and the student can decide what type of examination method they want to be tested by.

attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Make contents insurance mandatory for all council tenants
attributes.background:
We live in a semi detached house which we own.  This is an ex council house. The house that we are attached to is still owned by the Council.

As we have a morgage we have to take out building and contents insurance. 

But if you are a council Tennant you don't have to have insurance of any kind
attributes.additional_details:
The house next door had a very sevier fire and we have been out of our house for a long time

Our insurance covered us for our damage but as there is not any insurance with the next door property our insurance premium will go up

I was not aware that insurance is optional if you are a council tenant and even though none of this is our fault we are the ones left paying the price

Thing's  need to change and I don't think it's too much to ask a council tenant to take responsibility for themselves

attributes.action: Lower university fees down to £3,000 as they were before 2012.
attributes.background: People want to access further education but don't have the necessary funds to support themselves. By lowering the fees students will not leave university with crippling debts.

attributes.action: Make it law for all animal care workers to be animal first aid trained.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, it is not a legal requirement for animal care workers e.g. groomers, pet sitters, dog walkers, animal trainers and animal boarding, to have any animal first aid training. Through this petition we want pets to have the best care possible and ensure their welfare is paramount.
attributes.additional_details:
With this petition, we ask that it become law that ALL animal care workers have pet first aid training. As with all work places that legally must have human first aid qualified staff, we recommend that all animal-based businesses also have the same controls and measures in place that ensure staff are animal first aid trained.
Further, that animal care workers commit to undertake and continue with CPD, throughout their careers, to ensure that they have up-to-date animal first aid qualifications.

attributes.action: Make braces free for any child with a teeth issue.
attributes.background: Braces are ridiculously expensive, ranging from £1000 to £2000. Any under 18 with a teeth issue should receive free braces from the NHS, not just children with severe teeth issues.

attributes.action: Prevent Barack Obama from ever visiting the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Barack Obama should not be allowed to enter the UK in any capacity due to the killing of innocent Muslims by the US army whilst he was head of the US government. 

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/12/msf-afghanistan-hospital-airstrike-death-toll-42

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: Call for an international sporting boycott of the USA due to its discrimination
attributes.background: The US ban on muslim entry ignores several elements of The Geneva convention on Human rights:  "freedom of thought, conscience and religion" , "equality before the law" and "presumption of innocence until proven guilty". The ban will be used as "evidence" to incite and recruit potential terrorists.
attributes.additional_details: Dividing communities and creating an illusion of a war with Islam will provide "evidence" for those trying to recruit followers to terrorist groups. The ban could cause even those whose inclination is against violence to reconsider. It also introduces a dangerous direction of movement for the country which likes to be considered the leader of the free world. The sporting boycott showed South Africa how strongly the world disapproved of apartheid. A sporting Boycott of America would do the same.

attributes.action: International students in U.K should have a standard form of maintenance loan
attributes.background: As an international student I've personally been able to experience firsthand economic struggles at university. International students undoubtedly face economic strain with fees & limitations on their economic welfare the government should be able to place a standardised maintenance loan for us.
attributes.additional_details: Increase in international student fees from last year alone at Universities across the country.

attributes.action: Raise paternity pay to a minimum of 75% of your weekly income
attributes.background: Currently paternity leave is around £140 or 90% of your weekly income whichever is lower. Due to this fathers cant afford to take time off to be with a newborn or have to take annual leave. I myself just had a child and cant take paternity leave as I would be over £200 out of pocket each week.
attributes.additional_details: Lets get this to parliament and give fathers the chance to be with their kids from the start. There are all these fathers who don't want to spend time with their kids and the ones who do can't. Lets change this for fathers and kids in the UK lets allow fathers to bond with their newborns. Please sign this petition. THANKS

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and “speaking patterns”
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Make Mr Jeremy Hunt work in a busy hospital for a week so he can see for himself
attributes.background: It seems Mr Jeremy Hunt has an inaccurate view of the NHS and the pressure on it. Before he runs into the ground one of the greatest achievements in world history that is a big part of being British, he should work 12 hour shifts for a week to see how the system needs help.

attributes.action: Lobby the IOC in order for Darts to become an Olympic Sport.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport should create a task force in order to lobby the IOC for Darts to be recognised as a sport. They should then have direct involvement in the process of applying to become an Olympic Sport at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.additional_details:
Darts meets almost all requirements stipulated by the Olympic charter.

Sports with similar characteristics are currently already included in the Olympic programme such as Archery and Shooting. Darts is a true test of precision, accuracy, strategy, hand-eye coordination and pressure.

We, the undersigned urge the Government to step in, in order for Darts to have the best chance at becoming an Olympic Sport, and to gain the recognition the sport and it's competitors deserve.

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Ban cyclist strobe lights and flashing lights.
attributes.background: We all know the lights, the ones that blind you and flash at you and distract you whilst driving. A dimmer, non-flashing light would be much safer, the amount of people I have seen driving get distracted by those lights are ridiculous!

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity
